title: lost e-mail addresses
content: had ,for some reason, two thunderbird apps showing at e-mails so I deleted one but have now lost all e-mail addresses. Not IT savvy so cant resolve the issue
creator: pompeychris

title: Thuderbird will not open jpg attachment.
content: It says the associated helper application does not exist, and to change it in my preferences. Other file types seem to open OK.
creator: Kennymsq

title: Do I have 2 Mozilla accounts?
content: I have 2 email accounts. I have been using [edited] @yahoo.com for a long time. At some point, I got [edited] @gmail.com for more official-type emails. I don't care for gmail and use it very little. Yahoo was just okay but they have recently made some changes I despise. A friend recommended Thunderbird so I downloaded it but needed a mozilla account. Google was an option so I used my gmail account. However, I am a long-time Firefox user. Do I now have 2 mozilla accounts?
creator: carol.boquist

title: Security certificate exception
content:
Typically if I experience a security certificate exception, thunderbird will popup the certificate exception box, I click to get certificate and am done.

Today I cannot get the certificate popup to appear. which is fine I know where the certificates are managed but I have not a clue how to add a certificate OR what information to enter into the "Add security exception" dialogue box

Any help would be greatly appreciated.
creator: bluepennylady

title: Thunderbird Crashes whenever I open a Github.com link
content:
I have Thunderbird 128.6.0esr (64-bit) installed as a Flatpack package on Fedora, running on Gnome / Wayland.

Whenever I click a link in from an email from Github, that normally opens the browser, Thunderbird immediately freezes, and Gnome asks me if I want to kill Thunderbird. Waiting never works, and the link never opens. This is somewhat recent behavior.

Links to other websites *do* open. I know how strange this sounds. How can I debug this?
creator: evrt

title: Thunderbird with Exchange - synchronization
content:
Just setup a second Thunderbird profile for Exchange. Using Owl for Exchange plugin.

I right click onto a subfolder, and pick Properties, then go into Synchronization. I click onto a checkbox for "Select this folder for offline use" and I hit OK to close the window. Nothing happens. I go back, and the checkbox is not checked. I tried hitting the Download Now buttons, nothing happened.

Any clue why my check box selection is not accepted?

When I used Outlook, I set it up to use OST, so I have a copy of my email that is on the remote Exchange server. Now I am trying to do the same with Thunderbird.

Thank you
creator: mzl999

title: How to activate Thunderbird Mail Enterprise
content:
Dear technician,

I have configured my email account to Thunderbird mailbox, but the email sending speed is too slow and cannot be sent successfully.

When using Thunderbird mailbox mail merge plug-in, it always shows: Your email has been sent, but due to network or file access errors, the copy could not be placed in the outgoing backup folder (sent). How to set up the account to solve this problem, you can put the email into the outbox or draft box of the email account.

How to activate Thunderbird mailbox account enterprise version and enterprise version fee and daily email limit?
creator: emilia.ruan
